page.title: 14WINDRIDGE FARM
page.content: The farm is called Windridge Farm.It was not very windy when we went on our walk.It was a roasting hot day. Our teacher took some orange to drink and we had a rest.Mr. Hooper runs it with his two sons.His farmland and a farm house were mentioned in the original {Domesday book.}This year his main crop is Oilseed Rape. He also grows Barley.To guard the house he has some noisy dogs.When the land is very dry,in an exceptionally hot summer,the paddock behind the house shows evidence of Belgic round houses. The Fields abound in flint and often during ploughing flint tools and flint pot boilers are found.Coins from the {Roman}era and pottery pieces are to be picked up over the land.
